oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and characterization of CdS and CdSe nanoparticles prepared from novel intramolecularly stabilized single-source precursors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KANDASAMY, K
SINGH, HB
KULSHRESHTHA, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: monomeric selenolato complexes
molecule precursors
structural-characterization

selenide
sulfide
mercury

nanoparticle
cdse

hexagonal phase
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this note we describe the synthesis of cadmium sulphide and selenide nanoparticles from the corresponding novel single source precursors, M[E(Ox)](2) [E = S (1), Se (2); M = Cd; Ox = 2-(4,4-dimethyl-2- oxazolinyl)benzene] by thermolysing in tri-n-octylphosphine oxide (TOPO) at 280 degrees C, and their characterization by X-ray powder diffraction (XRD), transmission electron microscope (TEM) and scanning electron microscope (SEM) studies.
